author: Sean McLain
title: Nissan on Track to Report Record Yearly Profit
text:
YOKOHAMA, Japan—Nissan Motor Corp. said it was on track for a record profit for the year ending in March, thanks to a one-time boost from U.S. tax-law changes, but a sharp increase in incentives for American customers hurt operating profit.
Japan’s second-largest car maker by sales after Toyota Motor Corp. projected profit for the full fiscal year would grow to ¥705 billion ($6.4 billion), from ¥535 billion a year ago. But profit would have declined year-over-year without a ¥208 billion bump from adjusting its books to account... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
